author: {'steamid': '76561198069089362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1689809885}
review:
Only buy if you have a desperate need for an Emergency game. This title is a step backwards in almost all aspects compared to Emergency 4. Emergency 3 is better and more fun - from 2005!

The basic mechanics are exactly the same as the previous games - nothing new worth mentioning.

Unit and resource management is gone - you get a set amount of units at the start, with some joining later if events take place. This eliminates a lot of the skill in calling in the right units, and ability to get score by saving money. This makes some missions very easy, while in others you feel like you need more units. Firefighter with SCBA gear is never useful afaik. The firefighting plane/copter is extremely overpowered and trivializes all missions it appears in, as it's free to use and recharges frequently. In previous games you could afford to drop water maybe 2-3 times total, here you can do it every minute or so for free.

There are numerous AI/pathing bugs, units getting stuck, dog handler AI gets confused. Clicking a unit to select often doesn't work, you have to drag over it. The controls are just bad. The game crashed multiple times, in one mission I had to use cheats as it crashed 10 times in a row. The minimap is so tiny, it's almost useless. There are no difficulty options. I've found most missions to be very easy and boring.

The missions feel simplistic and uninspired, there is some theme to them, but there aren't enough interesting events or things to do. There is often so little choice, you feel the game plays itself. The missions are very linear and overly scripted. There's lots of micro as usual, but E 2014 takes it to an extreme level, with crew starting missions outside of the vehicles! So you get to put them in every time - neat.

This title technically contains E 2012, 2013, and 2014, but it's hardly 3 full games. E 2012 has 12 +3 missions, and is the only complete title. The other ones have 4-5 missions, of which one is effectively training, and they feel more like DLCs. I've completed all the campaigns in sub 8h - this is not what you'd expect from 3 games.

review:
Not optimized for modern systems.

I got a physical copy of Emergency 2012 Deluxe as a gift in 2012 and I ran it on a toaster without any issues. No stuttering, no crashing, nothing. Not a single issue playing for 3 years. Now I wanted to relive the nostalgia a bit because I think Quadriga's games are a wee bit misunderstood but apparently I forgot game devs don't care much about their product once it's on the shelves.

Intel i5-8000-something, 16 GB DDR 4 RAM, Nvidia GTX 1050 Ti. So it should run better than back then, right?

Hahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahahaha

Stuttering, looooots of stuttering. I was only able to get into freeplay. As soon as you move the camera, slideshow. What about the missions? Crashes straight after the cinematic every time and even freeplay crashed on me for seemingly no reason at all. Stay away from this one. If even Emergency 20 runs like hot crap on capable systems you bet this one's worse.

review:
Empfohlen
Sehr tolles Spiel, in meiner Jugend habe ich dieses Spiel locker pro Tag mehr als 5 Stunden gespielt.
Am spannendsten finde ich die Kampagne, da immer was noch passieren kann auch wenn die Sachen schon erledigt sind (z.b. bei dem Einsatz im Berlin mit dem eingestürzten Haus am ende).
Der Freie Modus ist auch sehr cool nur was mich stört ist die KI der Einheiten und das auf dauer weniger Einsätze kommen (z.b. habe ich bei einem Spielstand 4-5 Stunden gespielt und nach ca. der 4 Stunde kamen immer weniger Einsätze, am ende musste ich ca. knapp 10 Minuten warten bis der nächste Einsatz kam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198977092532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4298, 'last_played': 1599036214}
review:
Also, im Vergleich zu EM4 ein Rückschlag weil es keine Modding Option gibt -> Warum nicht? 
Im Vergleich zu EM5 ein Fortschritt, weil es keine eckligen Klammer gibt, es flüssigER läuft und das Szenario insgesamt zwar hoch dramatisch ist aber für Abwechslung sorgt.

Die Einheiten und die Skins sind sehr basic. Besonders die 2014er Ausgabe hätte ein anderes Polizei Fahrzeug als einen 96er BJ VW T4  als MTW kriegen können. Insgesamt sind die Marken zwar nicht lizensiert aber man erkennt welches Model es darstellen soll, Insgesamt sind die Autos eher Oldschool. In Em4 war es nicht so tragisch, weil Modder dies durch eigene Entwicklungen auswechselten.

Die Missionen fallen leicht ins Absurdum wie viele hier auch bemängelten, aber gerade das macht die Sache auch spannend. Die Mission Innsbrück ist mMn verbugt. Egal wie die Einheiten in den Zonen stehen, die Mission fällt durch (nach 8 versuchen hab ich gecheatet).  Was mich nervt ist der Intro in die Mission, dass man die Sequenzen nach der LoadScreen nicht überspringen kann. 

Im Vgl. zu Em4 gibt es keine freie Wahl mehr an Einsatzfahrzeugen. Zu jedem Einsatz werden die Fzg die benötigt werden zur Verfügung gestellt. Das hat Vorteile: Die RTW's werden automatisch so oft wie sie benötigt werden ersetzt und der Spieler macht sich keine Gedanken. Nachteile: Wer es gerne dramatisch hat, wird nicht auf seine Kosten kommen. Besondern bei Polizei Einsätzen wie Demos. 

Ein interessantes Feature fand ich die individuelle Beschriftung von Einsatzwagen. In den Einstellungen könnt ihr den Text den ein z.B. Polizei STW hat selbst aussuchen z.B. statt "POLIZEI" nur "POL" oder etwas was man selbst möchte z.B. absurdes wie "X4BOOB" 

In Emergency 6 würde ich mir eine größere Vielfalt an Fahrzeugen wünschen. Man sollte mehr als nur ein Fahrzeug Modell für einzelne Tätigkeiten haben. Das würde einfach die Dekoration ausschmücken. 
Ich habe etwa 70 Spielstunden gebraucht um alle Teile durch zu haben. Ich bin zufrieden mit der Zeit. 

Ein ganz großes Manko ist die Wegfindung. Blaulicht macht nur dann Sinn, wenn die Menschen und die Fahrzeuge auch ausweichen. Wenn ich ein Verdächtiges Auto anhalten möchte, versteht mein Polizei Auto nicht, dass er ihn überholen soll und so den Wegversperren. Statt dessen fahren die ihm einfach hinter her. 

Also im wesentlichen bereue ich die 10€ investition nicht. Es hat mir spaß gemacht, es wird mir bestimmt noch spaß bereiten aber es gibt deutlich Mankos, an denen die Entwickler noch arbeiten müssen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965752025', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 3819, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3492, 'last_played': 1660865455}
review:
I really like Emergency 2012-2014. It really makes fun and it's well balanced, challenging and gameplay is overall well done.
The Graphics are overall also well done. I think nothing to complain about.

Of course it's not a game for everyone. It is a Real Time Strategie game.

The most important part (and this makes E2012-2014 the best of the series) is the Input. They're are not always intuitiv, but they are modern and up to date. It takes a while to find all buttons, but if you learned them it's rock and roll. specially when you play a mission more than once. you learn more any time and you do better next  time.

4-5 things i would love to see as an update or in  a new version of this game.

1. Input rebinding. There is no possibilty to change the Inputs. That is sad.
2. Play the Singleplayer Missions in 2xPlayer Coop. That would be fun.
3. Multiplayer Endless or Challenge SAVEGAME. That would be a reason to buy this game again :D
4. The Game should detect the Main Window of Windows. So there is no need to Turn of second and/or third screen. But this is fine for a smaller Studio. Would just be nice.

5. This is not that important, but would keep it way more alive, if the Game would be expandable somehow.
Mission Creator, Map Creator, Asset Importer in one ort a nice Modding Tool :)

overall i really like E2012-E2014. The Challenge is hard in the beginning but it's makes the more fun the more you play it.

review:
“Uma série desconhecida por muitas pessoas, mas com uma ideia diferenciada fora do padrão RTS que estamos acostumados a ver.”

A série Emergency é uma criação da empresa alemã Quadriga Games e não é muito conhecida aqui no Brasil. O game consiste em colocar o jogador na administração de equipes de resgate como paramédicos, policiais, bombeiros e técnico de segurança no qual devem suprir a população de todos os eventuais acontecimentos. Sua mecânica é de estratégia em tempo real, porém com um toque próprio já que não guerreamos com nenhum inimigo já que estamos tão acostumados com jogos de guerra nesse estilo.

O maior inimigo do Emergency 2014 é o tempo para executar as missões, visto que a cada nova missão elas se tornam mais difíceis e requerem um melhor administração do tempo e de suas unidades. Cada tipo de unidade possui suas características próprias e são determinadas para cada tipo de tarefa, entender o funcionamento de cada unidade é essencial para o bom desempenho nas missões.

Emergency 2014 engloba as missões do Emergency 2013 e 2012, ou seja, você terá um universo muito maior de missões para encarar, cada missão acontece em um local do continente europeu e alguns deles são bem famosos. A grande diversão do game é o seu desafio, de acordo com que o resgate seja demorado mais pessoas são atingidas e a área de atuação se torna mais difícil, pois novos acontecimentos prevalecem.

Além do modo campanha o game também oferece um modo free play onde você escolhe uma cidade e deve prestar os serviços de acordo com os eventos que acontecem aleatoriamente. Nesse modo é possível escolher jogar em desafio no qual você tem pouco dinheiro e ao passar do tempo os problemas aumentam ou o modo sandbox que é apenas um modo que ao meu ver serve como um extenso tutorial.

Os gráficos do Emergency 2014 são um problema a parte, o jogo é mal otimizado e apenas algumas placas de vídeo suportam rodá-lo com eficiência, caso você não possua essa placa terá que jogar com gráficos serrilhados e de baixa resolução. Outro problema é que ao tentar alterar as opções gráficas o jogo apresenta um erro ao iniciar a campanha deixando a tela completamente branca e impossibilitando a jogatina. De modo geral o game é satisfatório mais precisa melhorar muito, pois houve pouquíssimas diferenças de suas versões anteriores para essa, Emergency é um RTS diferente e vale a pena dar uma conferida.

review:
It's weird that a game so fundamentally stupid is still so fun.

I've been playing the Emergency series since the 2D original Fighters for Life, and in spite of the less well-designed scenarios - Especially the cop missions, which are consistently terrible - it remains a fascinating game to play.

I probably only feel that way, because the rest of the industry lacks the imagination to design a game about EMTs or firefighters, and letting people experience the thrill of actually saving lives - Much in the way that Swat 3 was amazing, because you really wanted to avoid killing anybody.

But until the more established parts of the industry finds the courage to do something similar, and better, this is as good as it's gonna get.

review: I recommend this game to any strategist looking for an out of the norm strategy game. The game includes Emergency 2012, 2013, and 2014. The Campaign missions are tough to beat but the most fun I've had with this game is in freeplay mode. In freeplay mode, you choose from one of two options, Endless game, which is a stream of different emergencies you must respond to that stay relatively the same difficulty wise. In Challenge mode, each emergency that you must respond to gets more difficult to the point where your recources are spread thin and you're trying desperately to complete a call to send those units to another call. Graphics aren't all that great but I have seen worse. Unlike previous titles such as Emergency 3 and Emergency 4 (911 First Responders in the US) the game is unmodable. If you're looking for a challenge I reccomend this game to you, but wait for it to go on sale. $19.99 is a little steep for the age of the game but overall I have enjoyed it and I think anyone looking for a challenge would enjoy this title as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017271295', 'num_games_owned': 1087, 'num_reviews': 483, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1438431672}
review:
J'ai beau n'avoir que très peu d'intérêt pour le genre gestion/stratégie, l'idée de venir à bout de situations catastrophes (parfois un peu débiles) avec plein de bonshommes en uniforme me paraissait étonnament fun.

Les premières missions se déroulent d'ailleurs sans encombres et même si certaines mécaniques sont parfois mal expliquées, j'arrive à gérer. Les ennuis commencent lorsque que les dangers se multiplient, les unités à gérer augmentent et la micro-gestion fait son apparition. Il devient alors agaçant de devoir lutter contre les angles de caméra, le pathfinding et la difficulté à effectuer des actions précises et rapides. 

On finit alors par recommencer encore et encore la même mission car on ne nous avait pas dit comment installer un barrage pour bloquer un véhicule ou secourir quelqu'un avec un hélicoptère. Puis, on se rend compte également que le déroulement des missions est plus ou moins aléatoire en fonction de la tournure des évènements ; ce qui est intéressant sur le papier et plutôt réaliste. Sauf qu'ici, ça vient se rajouter à un gameplay globalement assez imprécis et surtout très mal introduit. On passe de missions très simples à du grand n'importe quoi, sans le moindre palier ou la moindre explication sur tel ou tel unité. C'est dommage, le contenu semblait au rendez-vous et la réalisation honnête.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025503879', 'num_games_owned': 436, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1438075886}
review:
The idea is great, and so are the first three missions (actually straight from Emergency 2012). A bit braindead response personnel, however (you have to make ALL of their decisions). What ambulance workers don't understand that the best possible action after picking up a wounded person on a stretcher is not just standing there with said stretcher but loading him/her into the ambulance they came from? And does a firefighter really need to be told to extinguish the fire in the tree next to him instead of just standing still when the fire he's been flooding has been put out?

After those three missions, it's simply not fun anymore. The missions get too complicated (and too long!) for the "I make all the decisions" mechanic to work. I would have preferred a role of response commander, telling people what to focus on instead of exactly what to do, but just splitting the missons into smaller parts with checkpoints or similar (so that a late mistake doesn't screw up your total rating after 20+ minutes of perfect play) would go a long way.

This game is overcomplicated, unrealistic and not fun at all. Avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025496703', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1437917307}
review:
Dumm geboren und nichts dazugelernt. Was sonst könnte man über das Entwicklerteam sagen? Aufgrund meiner Erfahrungen mit der Vorversion, die sogar mehr Spaß gemacht hat als diese hier, und das will schon was heissen, habe ich das Spiel nicht sofort gekauft. Erst jetzt über das Humblebundle. Was ich nicht erwartet habe: Sogar die 7$ tun mir jetzt noch weh, nicht wegen des Geldes sondern weil der Publisher nicht einen cent für diesen Müllhaufen verdient hat. Zum Glück waren noch andere Spiele im Bundle...

Unter Windows 7 64 bit Pro auf einem i7 mit 16GB RAM stürzt das Spiel noch vor dem Intro ab. Erst einige Kommentare hier auf Steam brachten die Lösung: Physx mit der mitgelieferten Version reparieren. What? Ich habe Windows vor 3 Tagen frisch installiert, die aktuellen NVidia-Treiber komplett installiert und trotzdem besteht das Spiel auf einer eigenen Version von Physx? 

Es fängt schon mit den Tutorials an: Ladezeit trotz ausreichend Speicher und SSD-Stripeset mit 800MB/s Datendurchsatz: 30 Sekunden. Das ist doch nicht wahr. Und was das schlimmste ist: die haben immer noch diese unsägliche Art, jegliche Nutzerinteraktion zu verbieten, bis der Ansagertext durchgelaufen ist. Vorab schonmal aus dem HLF aussteigen? Fehlanzeige. Schonmal einen Schlauch anschließen? Negativ. Während der Erklärung, wie man die Kamera bedient schonmal die Maus an den Rand fahren? Haha, iss nich. Das hat man mal 1999 gemacht, aber schnell verworfen. WEIL ES BESCHEUERT IST. UND DIE USER WÜTEND MACHT.

Man kann nicht mal die Ansagen überspringen. Und was das beste ist: Dieses Spiel reagiert nicht auf ALT-F4. Da sitzen Programmierer in dem Entwicklerstudio, die keine Ahnung von Ihrem Job haben. Das Spiel ist absolut unfertig, schlecht durchdacht, reagiert träge und geht null auf den Spieler ein.

Im free Play habe ich ca. 10 Minuten durchgehalten. Die AI der Einsatzkräfte verdient das I nicht. Null Intelligenz. Ich erwarte keine Superhelden, aber einen geringfügig höheren IQ als eine Semmel hätte ich schon erwartet.

Das Spiel ist so unspielbar, hätte ich es regulär gekauft, hätte ich von meinem Rücktrittsrecht gebrauch gemacht. So ist das Geld gemeinnützigen Zwecken zu gute gekommen, das mildert die Wut etwas.

Das war mein zweites und letztes Emergency. Wenn Ihr überlegt, es zu kaufen: Finger weg. Bringt nur Frust.

review:
2012から、2013.2014までセール時になんとな～く購入してきました。
ミッションは難しくそれなりのボリューム。
自分が好きなのはフリープレイモードですのでその感想を！

良い点
・今までにない非戦闘タイプ（スナイパーミッションはありますが）
・SIM系タイクーン系とも違い街は発展もせず廃れもしない
・町並みはリアルで天候もリアル
・緊急車両を操れる！という爽快感
以上の事が好きな方にはオススメ！

悪い点

・単調なミッションの繰り返し
・爆発等で負傷者が地面にめり込み救出不可
・緊急車両なのに一般車と同じ速度、追い越しはするが微妙な到達時間
・フリープレイ時は全車種を使いたい
・消防車のカスタマイズが出来ない
（ポンプ吐出量や乗車人員の増加位は…）
・はしご車のブームが伸びず、所持している意味がない

それでも楽しいからまた遣るんですけどねｗｗ

cheatは賛否両論ですが使うとまた面白さが増える
所有台数無制限等のチートで大量出動して第四出場！とか演出したり
レッカーで展示場の車全部撤去してみたりSWATヘリコプタで軍隊ゴッコしてみたり

review: I first got into the Emergency series when a family friend gave me Emergency Fire Response.  It  didn't work at all.  10 years passed, give or take, and I got the Emergency mobile for my phone.  On to the review.  The animation is snappy, the main theme is one of those songs that you look for a ten hour version on Youtube, and the AI is proactive, which is very useful in a game like this where you can have 5+ tasks at once.  Unfortunately, it was pretty rocky getting it to work.  At first, it crashed on startup, prompting a repair of the physx.  That fixed it until I put it on an external drive.  It crashed only on the 2014 missions, but a verification of game cache fixed that.  If you decide to get this game, be prepared for a frustrating half hour getting it running properly.  It is defineately worth it though.

review:
Only for the patient few. You have to be pretty fascinated with emergencies to be overbearing, luckuly I am for one. Othierwise you get piled up by frustrations build into most aspects of the game. 

On the plus side, you get three games in one (EM 2012-2013 and 2014). As a package the price is ok, but do wait for a sale. Prices have been €5-10, for which it would be an extremely good game.

I like this game a lot, and it has improved much since Emergency 4. Which means it is playable. For 2014 it is simply not good enough. There are things EM could have learned from even the earliest command and counquer games about unit control, which would improve the game a lot. 

It is lagging, hard to control, lacks hotkeys (to the best of my knowledge) and had issues with crashes. Basically I wonder if the developers forgot to test the game. Especially since it is uninstructive and without any levels, e.g. easy-hard for campaigns. Because of lagging and other issues I also miss a half speed, or any other way of cleaning up during challenges.

Being an EM geek, former firefighter and all I enjoy the game, but

review:
Updating my review, but it's still negative.

Pros: 
Looks Pretty- Graphics are good, I guess.

Good Mechanics- Easy to learn and use. UI is ok. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Cons:
Bad Multiplayer- It's turn based, practically a competition. There is no co-op mode. It was hard enough to set up the multiplayer in the first place. It's practically impossible.

Just a DLC- This is just DLC from Emergency 12. The only thing new is some vehicles and maps. Same goes with Emergency 13. They all just feel like DLCs. 

Not Moddable- The game is not moddable whatsoever. 

TERRIBLE SINGLEPLAYER MODE- Not talking about the story mode, I'm just talking about playing on free-play mode. There are only two options- Tutorial, and Challenge mode. You can't change the difficulty whatsoever.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Summary- Not a good game for its price. If it was 5 dollars, I would rate this positive. 

ALTERATIVES- 911: First Responders is a good game made by the same publisher. It's moddable but doesn't have a good screen resolution. Also, It's only available by downloading it on Amazon, not on Steam. Would reccomend getting that, as you get more bang for your buck.

review:
Em 2014 vs. EM 5

Betriebswirtschaftlich nennt man das glaube Cash Cow. Das Spiel läuft, hat eine Community und genug Deppen wie mich, die es kaufen :) Die Investition auf der Entwicklerseite hingegen ernüchternd.

Seit 3 bis 5 Spielversionen die gleiche Engine. Fahrzeuge die sich im Verkehr behindern, stecken bleiben, Irrläufer usw. Und das seit Jahren und der Kracher ist - die Engine wurde auch nach EM 5 übernommen und die Autos fahren teilweise immernoch in Situationen in denen Sie einfach fest stecken......:) 

Im Vergleich zu EM 5 für 50 € kann man EM 2014 nur positiv erwähnen. Ok die Grafik kann mit EM 5 nicht mithalten, dafür haben Polizisten Waffen anstatt Pfefferspray :) Es gibt ein SWAT Bodenteam mit Panzerwagen, es stürzt nicht andauernd ab. Die Missionen sind anspruchsvoll usw. Sehr schön an EM 2014 ist, dass es Schachtelmissionen gibt. Erst ein Teil und im gleichen Szenario folgt nach Erledigung der zweite Teil. Das macht das ganze spannend und Komplex. Die Missionen im Freispielmodus wiederholen sich weniger oft als in EM 5.

Auch toll ist das man selbst entscheiden kann mit welchen Fahrzeugen man sein Team erweitert. In EM 5 sind die leider vorgegeben und man muss das ganze Spiel mit einem Hebekran arbeiten wo in den Missionen immer mind. 3 Personen von schweren Steinen begraben sind. Hier kann ich Hebekräne kaufen so viel ich will und effizient meine Leute retten. Und einen Bagger habe ich auch noch, da ist die Mission Moskau schwupp die wupp erledigt. 

Ebenso gibt es ein großen Krankentransport für eine Vielzahl verletzte in einer Mission und eine Sprungmatte wo sich Passanten mit einem berherzten Sprung aus dem Fenster retten können wenn es brennt. 

Ich selbst habe ca. 160 Stunden mit den EM4 Teilen verbracht davon knapp 90 mit der Steam Version.
EM 5 waren ca. 10 Stunden.

Zu hoffen bleibt das man sich der Emergency Reihe noch einmal annimmt und das Potenzial was drin steckt auch rausholt. 

Als Fan empfehle ich das Spiel mit allen Missionen und Zusatzpacks eher als den Nachfolger Em5. Die Grafik ist ok, aber der spielspass langanhaltender und besser.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022514722', 'num_games_owned': 1080, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 1010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1419943257}
review:
Die Idee hinter dem Spiel ist ja ganz gut, aber die technische Umsetzung lässt zu wünschen übrig. Teilweise ist die Kontrolle der Einheiten einfach nur zu schwer. Vor allem, wenn die Zeit drängt und man dutzende Personen befehligen muss. Warum gibt es hier keine Pause-Funktion, während der man zumindest planen kann.

Das Problem ist dabei, dass die Wegfindung teilweise nicht richtig funktioniert. So kann es passieren, dass sich die Einheiten gegenseitig blockieren oder gar nicht erst losgehen/fahren. Mir ist schon öfters passiert, dass ein Feuerwehrwagen irgendwo steckengeblieben ist und ich das erst zu spät bemerkt habe.

Warum kann man bei bestimmten Funktionen nicht einfach sagen: Evakuiert das Gebiet. Und die Feuerwehrleute und Polizisten machen das dann autonom. Anstatt also einzelne Einheiten zu steuern, hätten man auch Aufgaben verteilen können.

Es stimmt, was viele schreiben ... das Mikromanagement ist einfach zu hardcore, bei der Anzahl der Einheiten und der knappen Zeit. Teilweise ist es aber auch eben anspruchsvoll ... nervig dabei ist, dass es keine Checkpoints gibt (sobald ein Ereignis auf ein anderes folgt). So kann es schnell passieren, dass man wegen einer toten Person die gesamte Mission erneut spielen darf.

Die Grafiken fetzen mich nicht. Ich habe einen noch guten Rechner und kann Crysis etc. gut zocken. Aber bei diesem Spiel musste ich so ziemlich alles auf "niedrig" oder "aus" stellen, damit es nicht immer so ruckelt. Ich vermute, es sind die Partikeleffekte (Feuer, Rauch, etc.). Dabei sehen die nicht mal besonders gut aus.

Wie gesagt, die Spielidee ist gut, ganz nette Einheiten etc. ... aber die Umsetzung ist echt erbärmlich. Man merkt, dass es nicht durchdacht ist. Egal ... das komplette Paket für 5€ ist schon okay. Es ist vor allem interessant für zwischendurch und es ist teilweise auch schnell zu schaffen, wenn man die Mission paar mal durch hat. Ich habe nun in 2(?) Tagen sowohl Emergency 2012, 2013 durch und bin bei 2014 angelangt.

review:
Se si possiedono Emergency 2012 e Emergency 2013, questo nuovo capitolo potrebbe non convenire se non in forte sconto o per grandi appassionati.

Ma se non li avete mai comprati, Emergency 2014 diviene un titolo VERAMENTE interessante, poichè comprende anche gli altri!
Vi ritroverete quindi a giocare con Emergency 2012 - 2013 - 2014 e relative mappe libere per decine (o centinaia?) ore di gioco!

Note generali:
+ Bella grafica (va da se che migliori nelle varie versioni)
+ Azione diversificata
+ Decine di mezzi e attrezzature
+ Sottotitolato in Italiano
+ Grande longevità
+ L'avventura libera permette di continuare a giocare ad oltranza

- Non vi è una vera diversità tra i tre capitoli.
- Intelligenza artificiale degli uomini non sempre brillante.
- Curva di difficoltà piuttosto ripida (ci troveremo a gestire svariate situazioni al contempo)

review: 警察と消防、救急、それと技術者を統括する機関を指揮するシリーズの2014年版です。猛暑・厳寒・豪雨といった異常気象がテーマの2012、火山の噴火がテーマの2013、隕石の落下がテーマの2014と、1本で3本分が含まれています。救急隊員が応急処置できなかったり（別に医師を出動させる必要がある）、爆弾処理をするのが警察ではなく技術者だったり、と日本とは異なる部分もありますが、延々と遊べるエンドレスモードもあり、お勧めです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197990665326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1768, 'last_played': 1627971740}
review:
This is a very interesting concept of a game, and the missions are quite interesting, and there's a rather nice freeplay mode... the problem is, the controls are rather... awkward.  Your emergency personnel have almost no independent initiative whatsoever - for instance, in order to recover a casualty, you need to order your ambulance to move to them, order your paramedics to get out of the vehicle, order them to pick up the casualty, order them to return to the ambulance, and then (if in freeplay) order them to return to base.  Generally, unless given explicit orders, your units won't do anything on their own... and complicating things, the interface for selecting and controlling your units is awkward.

Civilians are even worse.  Its not that they panic upon seeing danger or anything, they just don't notice.  They'll happily walk into a fire or a poison cloud... or, popularly, an electrified wire.  You're supposed to be able to order police to establish a cordon, but this requires so much handholding it's almost pointless.

That said, if the concept appeals to you, the game is quite fun.  It just has quite a few rough edges.

review:
Emergency - это линейка стратегий позволяющая нам руководить специальными службами быстрого реагирования: полицией, пожарными, техниками и медиками.  Emergency 2014 представляет из себя сборник игр из (EM 2012, 2013, 2014) - все лучшее вышедшее за последние годы в одном. В игре есть несколько режимов игры:

1) Сюжетные миссии - это крупномасштабные операции. Последствия после большого землятрясения, последствия крупного ДТП и т.д.  Чем быстрее и качественней вы выполните задание, тем лучше.

2)Бесконечная игра - этот режим игры не несет никакого сюжета. Есть условная местность, где мы ведем борьбу с различными проишествиями. Это может быть что угодно: человеку стало плохо - требуется мед. помощь, бешеная собака нападает на людей, корманная кража, ограбление банка, пожар от неисправного электроприбора, террористы с бомбами, сломанный светофор - угроза ДТП и многое, многое другое. В отличии от сюжета здесь не будет крупных операций, но различные проишествия могут появляться хаотично, в любой точке карты. Ваша же задача избегать жертв среди мирного населения, избегать возникновения пробок на дорогах и по возможности арестовывать всех бандитов и зачинщиков беспорядков. 

3) Испытание - этот режим похож на бесконечную борьбу. Отличие лишь в том, что все задания постепенно будут усложняться. 

В игре так же есть мультиплер на 4 человек, где мы можем вместе с друзьями вести борьбу со стихиями в режимах "Бесконечная борьба" и "Испытание".

Игра понравится лишь тем, кто любит подобные игры, потому всем и каждому я рекомендовать ее не буду. Но я уверен, что любители подобных симуляторов остануться довольны игрой так же как и я)
Единственным минусом здесь является отсутствие русского языка (официально), но существует и любительский русификатор, который отлично работает. На этом закончу свой мини-обзор ^_^

Играйте только в хорошее =)

review:
I love the idea of this game, and the UI is pretty great.  Unfortunately, that's where my positive comments have to end.  This game is insanely hard and unforgiving.  There are no difficulty options to make it easier if you just want to have a good time.  You can't fail to handle a situation and continue on with a penalty.  That fire will rage out of control.  The rioters will eventually overrun the city.  A traffic accident becomes a traffic jam, which spawns more accidents...An uncontrolled disease becomes an epidemic...etc.

Pass on this and hope for something similar with more of an eye toward having fun than frustrating customers into a stupor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019635591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1394773785}
review:
Sort of fun if you like the idea of an emergency rescue sim, or are like me and loved playing Rescue Heroes games as a kid and wanted a more age and skill appropriate equivalent.

Unfortunately, the concept is really the only good thing about it. I have some RTS knowledge and experience – at least, enough to notice the glaring flaws in this game. First, the camera is not very smooth or easy to control. If you’re just looking at the main screen, using WADS to move about, it seems okay albeit sluggish.  However, once you try to use the mini map, its as if the movements you make aren’t corresponding at all, as if up is left and right is down on the map. So, if you’re trying to get to the scene of an accident, it’s best to just click on the mini map. Some of the controls aren’t the best either, and are not re-bindable from what I can tell from the menus.

Then there’s the pathing. This was the absolute worst part of the game for me, as it severely limited the enjoyment I got out of playing.  In almost every instance, emergency vehicles took forever to arrive at a scene, and it was because they were too busy driving in circles, trying to turn around at dead ends, or getting stuck at the side of the road.  I would always have to find where they went and redirect them. If there’s only one thing happening, it’s not too bad I guess, but in free play with multiple cases, it gets way to chaotic and annoying. I thought it might have been caused by a traffic game in my game, but then I remembered that the first time I loaded this game, there was an accident near a body of water and the firetrucks repeatedly drove on the grass near it, getting themselves stuck, instead of driving on the road nearest the crash. This pathing issue is prevalent in every iteration of the game, from 2012 to 2014, which all come with this copy.

Now, about the traffic jam. This game is also pretty buggy. At one intersection, a huge truck decided to stop at one of the lights and never move, no matter what color the light changed to.  It was extremely frustrating to deal with because it was on the road right outside the HQ, so all of my emergency vehicles were having a really difficult time getting to the scene, especially if I had to call multiple vehicles at once.  I don’t know if there is any sort of console debugger in this game, but it would have greatly helped with the stuck car.  Instead I tried to use the in-game mechanics.  First, I thought it might have gotten damaged, so I tried to tow it to no avail. Eventually, I called an officer to re-direct traffic out of the city, which finally cleared the jam up.

It might be worth it if you really like the idea of the game and don’t mind dealing with a less than smooth experience.  Otherwise, probably skip it.

review:
At first I thought I'd never have the desire to play it again after I tried to finish some missions in campaign mode since it was to much all at once without even tried the game before, no learning what the units can and can't do. 
Then I realised the true charm of this game is in the Freeplay Endless mode! I love that you can make more money and buy more units, but there is one really really big flaw in this mode... it does NOT have save game, which means you have to start over every time you want to do something else or leave your game on until you want to play more from where you were... the problem with no save is that you don't always have the time to earn enough money to afford the more expensive units like a mobile Intencive Care Unit for larger accidents. It probably has to do with that the game mode is a high score mode, however, I personally rather really play endlessly saving and loading on my own misfortunate town then caring for a high score.

With that said I find myself coming back for new games every day on endless mode and enjoy it very much!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032891306', 'num_games_owned': 491, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1523062979}
review:
While this is a deep and well-built emergency sim, it has too many fatal flaws for me to recommend it. You are regularly given far fewer personnel than you need to deal with the rapidly escalating threats. The map is almost pointless, being tiny and difficult to orientate. The announcer will call out that something else has happened but only rarely will the game show you where this is. The tutorial also ommits key information that is necessary for future missions. You'll be told to 'use the ladder' and 'set a roadblock' in a split second without knowing how to do this. When you have 3 doctors and ambulances to deal with around 7 fire casualties and 11 sickness casualties, very little indication on how to evacuate buildings, rescue suvivours and deal with at least 3 things at once, it's not much fun. The difficulty reaches extraordinatary levels very quickly and it becomes a stress management game, not an emergency response management game. Better controls, a clearer tutorial and a little more leeway would've made all the difference.

It's likely I'll come back to the game and may persevere to learn it's unexplained complexities but the fact remains that within an hour of purchase I'm already frustrated and confused.

review:
Per gli appassionati delle simulazioni di situazioni emergenziali, la saga di Emergency è ormai un appuntamento più che decennale. In quel marasma di produzioni tedesche simulative si inserisce anche questo gioco sviluppato ai suoi albori da Sixteen Tons Entertainment e poi da Quadriga Games nelle sue ultime incarnazioni. L'expansion pack Emergency 2014, pero', si configura un po' debole aggiungendo davvero poco (solo 4 missioni e qualche nuovo edificio), la sola modalità endless game non riesce a sostenere il peso di un gameplay che, nonostante la buona intuizione di trascendere il genere degli RTS, non riesce mai a sfondare davvero il cuore del videogiocatore. Il prezzo pare eccessivo, se state cercando solo l'expansion pack, diventa affrontabile, meglio ancora magari in periodo di sconto, se state cercando tutto il pacchetto omnicomprensivo (Emergency 2012 Deluxe, 2013 e 2014)

Leggi la recensione completa su: http://theshelternetwork.com/emergency-2014/

review:
Emergencyシリーズ最新作。これ一つで2012~2014のキャンペーンがプレイ可能。

キャンペーンモードは激ムズ。しかもクリアしないと次に進めない。過去作のように物量作戦もできないので、与えられた人員を適切に配置しないとなかなかクリアできない。

COOPもあるみたいだけど詳細不明。

面白いけど難易度の高さはきついかも知れない。せめて飛ばせたら・・・
